Our Vision

To improve market access and streamline supply chain transactions for smallholder farmers and buyers.


Why do we do what we do?

Why do we do what we do?

>60% of the population

in sub-Saharan Africa work in agriculture. Many are smallholder farmers, who produce 80% of the food supply there.

>50% of household income

is from agriculture. For example, in Tanzania, 56% of a smallholder's family income comes from farming. In Kenya, it's 60%.

>40% faced market shocks

in the last 5 years. This is in the form of decreased crop prices and increased input prices, which gets worsened by inadequate access to realtime market information.

How does it work?

Here's a preview of the platform.

About our journey

  • 2016

    How we started

    Our co-founders met during their PhDs at the University of Cambridge. Brought together by their interest in global food security, they began brainstorming ideas on how technology can enable smallholder farmers to earn more for more. The team further developed the idea and successfully pitched to Pre-Accelerate program at the Cambridge Judge Business School.

  • May 2017

    Serious Impact Accelerator

    We entered the Allia's Serious Impact Accelerator, where we learned about how to manage a social impact venture. This included sales & marketing, operations, and finance.

  • July 2017

    Winning the Agri-Tech East GROW competition

    We won the best Business Plan award, as part of the Agri-Tech East GROW competition. The support we received from our mentors during this competition was fundamental in helping us improve our thinking.

  • Nov 2017

    Prototyping at the Serious Impact Incubator

    We accelerated our startup's development at the Allia Serious Impact incubator. This included a focus on prototype development so that it would be ready for piloting in our next phase. Our specific aims were to finalise the platform prototype so that it works seamlessly between smartphones and basic SMS phones.

  • Join us
    on our
    journey!

    Interested in our activities?

    We're getting ready to trial our platform. Whether you're a farmer, buyer, member of a farmers' group, or a data analyst, we're more than happy to hear from you. Join us on our journey by registering your interest below.

Our team

Dr Jacqui Poon

CEO & Co-founder


Jacqui coordinates business and product development and oversees partnership engagement. She holds a doctorate in plant pathology (2016) from the University of Cambridge and has a background in cassava post-harvest deterioration (MSc 2012). She believes that enabling smallholder farmers to access better markets makes a positive impact on their livelihoods.

David Godding

CTO & Co-founder


David manages tech development of our platform and develops algorithms for our data analytics. He is a PhD candidate for plant epidemiology at the University of Cambridge, where he models the spread of cassava diseases.

Dr Paul Bergen

Director & Co-founder


Paul has a background in bacteriology and infectious diseases. He holds a doctorate from the University of Cambridge (2018). He sees that health, food security, and family income are intricately linked, so he believes that giving smallholder farmers the tools and data to reach better markets will greatly improve their quality of life.

Greg Wilsenach

Systems engineer


PhD Computer Science
University of Cambridge

Kelvin Mei

Platform developer


PhD Physics
Princeton University

Marcel Meyer

Platform developer


PhD Epidemiology and Modelling
University of Cambridge

Contact Us

Simply drop us a message through email or other forms of social media below.

info@farmingdata.io

For farmers

After you register with us or sign-in to the platform, follow these simple steps.

1. Post what you're selling

Pick the crop, indicated your expected price and volume, and set a location near you for exchange.

2. Receive offers from buyers and make a decision

You'll receive offers as an SMS on your mobile phone (or in the App if you have a smartphone). We'll send you recent market prices and the buyer's open ratings. And you then decide if you want to accept or reject the offer.

3. Get your harvest ready and meet with the buyer to exchange

We'll send you an SMS which is unique and secures your transaction. Meet with the buyer at the collection point and swap your unique codes. Once you're both happy with the exchange, we'll send you the money straight to your mobile account!

4. Submit your feedback

Tell us how you rate your exchange experience. If you had a terrible experience, send us 1 out of 5 stars. If you had a wonderful experience, send us 5 out of 5 stars. We keep track of how our platform is doing so we can constantly make improvements.

For farmer groups

After you register with us or sign-in to the platform, follow these simple steps.

1. Message your members to post as a group

Indicate to your members which crop and expected volume you're planning to post as a group. You'll see and manage the list of responses, so you can plan more easily. Then, post to sell as a group by picking the crop, expected price and volume, and set a location near you for exchange.

2. Receive offers from buyers and make a decision

You'll receive offers in the App. We'll send you recent market prices and the buyer's open ratings. And you then decide if you want to accept or reject the offer. If you accept an offer, you'll be able to notify your members of the update.

3. Meet with members for aggregation and the buyer at the collection point

We'll send you an SMS which is unique and secures your transaction. Meet with your group's farmers at the aggregation point and swap your unique codes. Once you're finished aggregating, meet with the buyer and swap your unique codes. We'll send the money straight to your farmers' mobile accounts!

4. Submit your feedback

Tell us how you rate your exchange experience. If you had a terrible experience, send us 1 out of 5 stars. If you had a wonderful experience, send us 5 out of 5 stars. We keep track of how our platform is doing so we can constantly make improvements.

For buyers

After you register with us or sign-in to the platform, follow these simple steps.

1. Search and buy available crops near you

Pick a crop and enter the volume and price you want to buy. We'll show you a list and map view of results near you. Click on the posting's page to see more details about the crop and its producer.

2. Communicate logistics with your selected producer and send in your offer

Discuss logistics and negotiation details with the producer through the platform. With sufficient credit on your account, place an order to send in your offer. Your credit will be withheld safely until the exchange step.

3. Meet with the producer at collection point to exchange

We'll send you reminder notifications about when and where to pick up your crop, along with your unique swap code. When you meet, check that the order is correct and enter your unique swap codes on the App. Once this happens, we'll transfer your payment directly.

4. Submit your feedback

Tell us how you rate your exchange experience. If you had a terrible experience, send us 1 out of 5 stars. If you had a wonderful experience, send us 5 out of 5 stars. We keep track of how our platform is doing so we can constantly make improvements.

For Big Data lovers

A lot of information about informal agricultural markets remain largely unknown. To assist policymakers and other organisations in making data-informed decisions, we generate visual heatmaps through our algorithms and collection of unprecendented dataset.
This makes it easier for you to digest large data insights and to make better decisions.
